content.prompt: There is a strong positive correlation between the number of libraries in a city and higher performance on aptitude tests for students. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this correlation?

choices.label: Students with higher performance on aptitude tests causes them to visit libraries in a city.
The presence of libraries in a city leads to students reading more books, which can potentially lead to higher aptitude test scores.
Cities with high revenue is related to both the presence of libraries and higher aptitude test scores for students.
Increased reading due to more libraries causes students to study more.

skill.text: 2.C: Evaluate the appropriate use of research design elements in non-experimental methodologies.
